text: Auto Lux Transit Transit all right my
needle drops no time to lose we've got
to do an album review but one thing
before that the band women who have a
new album coming out this year public
strain I recently interviewed the singer
and guitarist from the band Patrick
flegel you can go down there in the
d-box and find a link to where you can
go listen to that or go just check out
our Tumblr account it's there Auto Lux
is a West Coast Trio who is often
overlooked in the world of art rock and
shoegaze simply because they don't
really have the heavyweight
discographies of bands like blonde
redhead or Sonic Youth autolux's debut
LP future perfect didn't exactly
reinvent the world of art rock but its
songs are really catchy really Snappy
visceral but there's also enough
experimentation and guitar noise in the
mix to make it feel like a little bit
more than just your average Rock record
and auto Lux really likes to do things
pretty much at their own pace that debut
album actually came out in 2004 and now
six years later we have its follow-up
Transit Transit and on this LP for the
most part it's pretty much Auto Lux as
you remember them they're really
building on their past sound drumming up
some interesting guitar effects but also
incorporating some newer elements to
like drum machines some piano balladri
Loops Arrangements multi-tracked
background vocals drum machines a lot of
different ideas being Incorporated on
this album and some real stylistic
shifts too this thing really does not
stay in one spot for a lot of the time I
hear elements of 60 psychedelic Rock
there are a few moments where this band
actually sounds a little bit like
Mercury rev to me especially in the
falsetto vocals and the very detailed
studio production and track three high
chair with its drum machine reminds me a
lot of maybe what black moth Super
Rainbow would sound like if they didn't
have so much Lo-Fi fuzz on their music
so Auto Lux is trying new things on this
record but it's kind of led to a sound
that overall is a little less menacing
than their debut which is really what I
dug so much about it it did have these
sweet pop sounds but then again there
was this kind of danger to it much of
the loudest sounds on Transit Transit
are kind of just sitting at the back of
the bus this thing really kind of wakes
up I want to say around track seven
there are some Rocky songs before that
track but yeah around there is when this
thing really starts to get voluminous
the title of that song is audience
number two and this song is really kind
of the auto Luxe I remember it just
seems like the music is happening right
there in front of you and you're just
being hit with so many different sounds
it's kind of like a sensory overload but
it's combined with really strong
songwriting I can't see this record
scoring extremely high with me mostly
because there were some potholes there
were just some tracks that I didn't care
for I want to say just about half of the
lp underwhelmed me either the tracks
didn't go far enough to produce an
interesting sound or a lot of the tracks
I felt were kind of hindered by all the
loops and the canned instrumentation it
depends on the track but there are some
moments where it'll sound like maybe the
guitar or maybe the drums aren't
actually being performed in a take but
are kind of just being cut and pasted
cut and pasted which for me leads to a
sound that is not very Dynamic and is
really not an aesthetic I like in my
rock music overall the lp didn't really
grip me but I could see how hardcore
fans who have just been dying for this
thing to be released will appreciate it
and I could see people digging it if
they're kind of looking for a friendlier
side of this genre of music something
that maybe is a little bit easier on the
ears I'm feeling a strong strong beefy
six on this record like it could almost
take down a seven if the these seven had
its back turned or something like that
just come up right behind it put it in a
headlock but other than that I'm really
not but that's pretty much where my ears
are at on this record wear your ears on
this record are you loving it are you
hating it and what would you score this
